A. Complete the Lewis electron-dot diagram of chloryl fluoride in the box by drawing in all bonding and nonbonding valence electrons.

aab+eadaWgaaWcbaGaaGOmaaqabaGccaqGgbGaaiikaiaadEgacaGG Paaaaa@3F85@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, is represented by the following equation.

<math alttext="2 C l O 2, gas, plus F 2, gas, react to produce 2 C l O 2 F, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

A. Complete the Lewis electron-dot diagram of chloryl fluoride in the box by drawing in all bonding and nonbonding valence electrons.

B. The following two-step mechanism is proposed for the reaction.

Step 1:

<math alttext="C l O 2, plus F 2, react to produce C l O 2 F, plus F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext><mtext> +</mtext><mtext> F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

slow

Step 2:

<math alttext="C l O 2, plus F, react to produce C l O 2 F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>F</mtext><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

fast

i. Explain why the collision represented in box 2 is more likely to result in a successful reaction according to the mechanism and the Lewis diagram in part (a).

ii. Write the rate law for the reaction using the proposed mechanism.
C. On the following graph, draw a reaction energy profile that is consistent with the proposed two-step reaction mechanism.

skill.text: 3.A: Represent chemical phenomena using appropriate graphing techniques, including correct scale and units.
